question: Which two countries share the location of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Caves of Aggtelek Karst and Slovak Karst"?
explanation: Hungary and Slovakia are the two countries that share the location of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Caves of Aggtelek Karst and Slovak Karst". This UNESCO World Heritage site includes seven components. They are Aggtelek, Szendro-Rudabanya Hill, and Esztramos Hill in Hungary, and Dobsina Ice Cave, Koniar plateau, Plesivec plateau, and neighbourhood of Silica and Jasov in Slovakia.
